text: by October 9, 2024Source: YouTube "He's an exceptional assassin. He will kill again. Unless we stop him." Peacock has revealed the full official trailer for an assassin thriller series titled The Day of the Jackal arriving for streaming in November. Yes it's based on the book (and British movie) of the same name. The 1973 movie is also called The Day of the Jackal, starring Edward Fox, and it's adapted from the book by Frederick Forsyth. There's a 1997 Hollywood movie called The Jackal also about an assassin, borrowing the same story with a few alterations. The series is a bold, contemporary re-imagining of the beloved and respected novel & film - presented as a cat & mouse chase. While remaining true to the DNA of the original, this contemporary drama will delve deeper into the life of the chameleon like "anti-hero" at the heart of the story, in a high octane, cinematic, globetrotting "cat & mouse" thriller, set amidst the turbulent geo-political landscape of these times. Academy Award winner Eddie Redmayne stars in this series as "the Jackal", with Lashana Lynch as Bianca, Úrsula Corberó, Charles Dance, Richard Dormer, Chukwudi Iwuji, Lia Williams, Khalid Abdalla, and Eleanor Matsuura. This is a properly thrilling trailer, with some slick shots and excellent performances. I'm down. Here's the full official trailer (+ poster) for Peacock's series The Day of the Jackal, direct from YouTube: You can rewatch the teaser trailer for Peacock's The Day of the Jackal series right here, for more footage. A ruthless assassin, the Jackal, (Eddie Redmayne) makes his living carrying out hits for the highest fee. But following his latest kill, he meets his match in a tenacious British intelligence officer (Lashana Lynch) who starts to track down the Jackal in a thrilling cat-and-mouse chase across Europe, leaving destruction in its wake. The Day of the Jackal is a series created and written and showrun by Irish screenwriter Ronan Bennett (The Break, Face, Fields of Gold, The Hamburg Cell, Public Enemies; and series "Rebel Heart", "10 Days to War", "Hidden", "Gunpowder", "Top Boy"). Additional writing from Charles Cumming, Shyam Popat, Jessica Sinyard. Adapted from the British novel of the same name written by Frederick Forsyth first published in 1971. With episodes directed by filmmaker Brian Kirk (Middletown, My Boy Jack, Gilded Lilys; eps of "Game of Thrones", "Great Expectations", "Penny Dreadful", "Hard Sun"), and also Paul Wilmshurst, Anu Menon, and Anthony Philipson. It's executive produced by Ronan Bennett, Sam Hoyle, Nigel Marchant, Gareth Neame, Eddie Redmayne, Brian Kirk. Made by Carnival Films & Sky Studios. The Day of the Jackal debuts streaming on Peacock starting November 14th, 2024 + in the UK on November 7th. Look good? Find more posts: Streaming, To Watch, Trailer

"He's an exceptional assassin. He will kill again. Unless we stop him." Peacock has revealed the full official trailer for an assassin thriller series titled The Day of the Jackal arriving for streaming in November. Yes it's based on the book (and British movie) of the same name. The 1973 movie is also called The Day of the Jackal, starring Edward Fox, and it's adapted from the book by Frederick Forsyth. There's a 1997 Hollywood movie called The Jackal also about an assassin, borrowing the same story with a few alterations. The series is a bold, contemporary re-imagining of the beloved and respected novel & film - presented as a cat & mouse chase. While remaining true to the DNA of the original, this contemporary drama will delve deeper into the life of the chameleon like "anti-hero" at the heart of the story, in a high octane, cinematic, globetrotting "cat & mouse" thriller, set amidst the turbulent geo-political landscape of these times. Academy Award winner Eddie Redmayne stars in this series as "the Jackal", with Lashana Lynch as Bianca, Úrsula Corberó, Charles Dance, Richard Dormer, Chukwudi Iwuji, Lia Williams, Khalid Abdalla, and Eleanor Matsuura. This is a properly thrilling trailer, with some slick shots and excellent performances. I'm down.

Here's the full official trailer (+ poster) for Peacock's series The Day of the Jackal, direct from YouTube:

You can rewatch the teaser trailer for Peacock's The Day of the Jackal series right here, for more footage.

A ruthless assassin, the Jackal, (Eddie Redmayne) makes his living carrying out hits for the highest fee. But following his latest kill, he meets his match in a tenacious British intelligence officer (Lashana Lynch) who starts to track down the Jackal in a thrilling cat-and-mouse chase across Europe, leaving destruction in its wake. The Day of the Jackal is a series created and written and showrun by Irish screenwriter Ronan Bennett (The Break, Face, Fields of Gold, The Hamburg Cell, Public Enemies; and series "Rebel Heart", "10 Days to War", "Hidden", "Gunpowder", "Top Boy"). Additional writing from Charles Cumming, Shyam Popat, Jessica Sinyard. Adapted from the British novel of the same name written by Frederick Forsyth first published in 1971. With episodes directed by filmmaker Brian Kirk (Middletown, My Boy Jack, Gilded Lilys; eps of "Game of Thrones", "Great Expectations", "Penny Dreadful", "Hard Sun"), and also Paul Wilmshurst, Anu Menon, and Anthony Philipson. It's executive produced by Ronan Bennett, Sam Hoyle, Nigel Marchant, Gareth Neame, Eddie Redmayne, Brian Kirk. Made by Carnival Films & Sky Studios. The Day of the Jackal debuts streaming on Peacock starting November 14th, 2024 + in the UK on November 7th. Look good?
